rationale: The segment does not contain an intensifier or comparative adjective directly modifying a risk-adjective.
The segment provides a factual description ('have been no confirmed human-to-human transfers', 'three people... were infected') without high-potency framing.
The verbs 'have been' and 'were infected' are not moderate verbs.
No loaded rhetorical question is present in the text.
The segment reports positive facts (no human-to-human) but lacks explicit calming language.
The segment does not contain a minimiser used in conjunction with a scale contrast.
The segment contains a bare negation: 'no confirmed human-to-human transfers'.
